Title: Expert in ML/AI/NLP
Description:
Job Description

WORKING METHODS, ENVIRONMENT AND CONDITIONS

Project duration: 600 days

Initial contract duration: 180 days

Expected start date: ASAP

Service delivery mode: Near-Site in Brussels

SPECIFIC EXPERTISE


Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM).
Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems
Knowledge of Graph Databases.


Knowledge And Skills

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:


Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies.
Experience in the field of corpus-based linguistics.
Experience with alignment models and classification methods.
Experience with data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes.
Good knowledge of information systems matters.
Good knowledge of large organisation administrative business processes.
Good knowledge of analysis/modelling tools and techniques (use case diagram, state diagram, entity relationship model, interaction diagrams etc.).
Good knowledge of BPMN or UML or other with equivalent value.
Good knowledge of Wiki and collaborative sites.
Knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., RUP, Agile).
Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL.
Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Qlik, SAS, SAP, GoodData…)
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (SAS, Talend Open Studio…)
Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
Rapid self-starting capability.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong capacity in preparing and writing business analysis.
Capability to speak to business and technical audiences.
Strong capacity to give high-level presentations.
Excellent critical thinker, by using logic and reasoning to identify strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions.
Ability to apply high quality standards.
Ability to participate in multi-lingual meetings, excellent communicator.


Qualifications

A minimum educational qualification: Level of education corresponding to Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor degree of 3 years.

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Company Description

Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

Job Description

They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.

ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:


Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment


Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.

Additional Information

Technical Experience Required:


Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql
Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools
Show more

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

  • You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.

What We Can Offer You

  • A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
  • The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
  • A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
  • Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
  • A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
  • Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
  • The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.


This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.


Responsabilities:

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units’ business needs;
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed.


Technical skills:

  • Data Analytics techniques and tools.
  • Power BI (including Power Query).
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other business intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory…).
  • SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
  • Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems.


Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree minimum
  • English fluent
  • Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving.


Why Cronos Group?

We’ll propose you:

  • An attractive salary package
  • A good work-life balance environment
  • The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
  • A good job in a friendly place

If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.




Job Title: Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B




Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.
Develop algorithms and statistical models to optimize machine learning models and improve their accuracy.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advances in machine learning and data science.




Expected Skills & Capabilities




Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.
Understanding and experience with AWS SageMaker
Background working closely with Snowflake
Experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Extensive experience with infrastructure as a code (IAC), particularly with AWS CDK.

Title: AI / ML Engineer
Description:
Bij Tensr vertalen we complexe data naar grensverleggende business oplossingen. Als onze nieuwe Data Consultant stap je in een dynamisch team en help je bedrijven voorop lopen in de wereld van AI. Ben jij de proactieve expert die onze klanten begeleidt in hun transitie naar een datagedreven toekomst? Dan zoeken wij jou!


Je wordt onderdeel van een dynamisch team van data-experts en helpt bedrijven pionieren in de snel veranderende wereld van AI.
Je speelt een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van innovatieve dataoplossingen, van concept tot realisatie.
Je communiceert met klanten om hun noden te begrijpen en begeleidt hen in hun transitie naar een AI- en datagedreven organisatie.
Je gaat hands-on aan de slag met code, voornamelijk in Python, om robuuste dataoplossingen te ontwerpen en implementeren op het Google Cloud Platform.
Je presenteert jouw oplossingen en inzichten aan zowel een technisch als niet-technisch publiek en toont zo de meerwaarde van AI en data.
Je werkt samen met je team om schaalbare oplossingen te ontwerpen en uit te rollen op GCP.
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een rol als data expert, bijvoorbeeld als data scientist, data engineer of ML engineer.
Je bent bedreven in Python.
Je hebt een sterke kennis van (of bent bereid te leren over) het Google Cloud Platform, specifiek Vertex AI en BigQuery.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatie- en presentatievaardigheden.
Je bent vloeiend in het Engels en Nederlands (zowel gesproken als geschreven).
Je bent zelfstandig, proactief en voelt je thuis in een omgeving met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid.
Ervaring met computer vision-projecten is een grote plus.


Wij zijn een jong bedrijf waar een geweldige sfeer en persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal staan. We bieden een ondersteunende en inspirerende werkomgeving waarin je écht kan pionieren in de wereld van AI.


Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket aan extralegale voordelen.
Pionieren met de beste tech: De kans om te werken met de nieuwste en beste technologieën in de AI- en datawereld, met een focus op het Google Cloud Platform.
Uniek persoonlijk groeipad: Stippel mee je groeipad uit; wij bieden de begeleiding en ondersteuning om jouw doelen te bereiken.
Een bruisende cultuur: Geniet van een leuke bedrijfscultuur met regelmatige teamactiviteiten, veel vrijheid en een team van gemotiveerde collega's.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Company Intro


At Toloka AI we create data that powers leading GenAI models and innovations. We work with frontier labs, big tech, renowned AI startups, enterprises and non-profit research organizations worldwide. We use a combination of Experts + Crowd + Tech Platform to teach AI models to reason and evaluate their efficacy and safety. We have experts in more than 50 different domains—from doctors and lawyers to physicists and engineers—and boast one of the most diverse global crowds, representing over 100 countries and speaking 40+ languages. We are a well-funded startup with an enviable portfolio of clients including Anthropic, Amazon, Microsoft, poolside, Recraft, and Shopify.


Recently, we secured strategic investment led by Bezos Expeditions with participation from Mikhail Parakhin, CTO of Shopify and board advisor to leading GenAI companies, who now serves as our Chairman of the Board. Our remote-first team is globally distributed around the world: USA, UK, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more. We are headquartered in Amsterdam.


About the role


We believe the future of work lies in effective AI–human collaboration, not in purely autonomous systems operating on their own.


That’s why we’re building Hybrid Agents – systems where AI and human experts work side-by-side, solve tasks together, and leverage each other’s strengths. From general-purpose tasks to highly specialized professional domains, our platform unites people and models, backed by state-of-the-art technology and a growing marketplace of expert talent.


As an AI/ML Engineer, you will be a core contributor to the AI layer of our product.


What You’ll Work On


  • Build agentic systems and develop skills such as search, browsing, coding, and more;
  • Design and experiment with hybrid-execution mechanics, including human hand-off and result validation;
  • Develop automated evaluations that measure system quality on real-world tasks;
  • Research and integrate state-of-the-art techniques to improve core quality and agent skills;
  • Develop and maintain production services;
  • Contribute to agent infrastructure – tools, environments, and third-party integrations.


Qualifications


  • 3+ years of industry experience in machine learning;
  • Solid understanding of how modern deep-learning models work, including their strengths and limitations;
  • Experience developing software and building products with language models;
  • Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python and commonly used ML frameworks;
  • Proven track record of delivering ML-driven products.


Preferred but not required


  • Experience building complex agentic systems;
  • Experience designing or implementing evaluation metrics;
  • Contributions to ML research projects;
  • Fluency in English.


What we can offer


  • You’ll have the opportunity to work on highly innovative, projects at the leading edge of AI development, and work with a genuinely dedicated and dynamic team of experts;
  • You’ll also be working on projects with customers that are AI industry leaders and household names;
  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave and sick leave;
  • 25 vacation days per year.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

About Remobi:

We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.




Join our Remobi community to have access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate!







Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: End of September 2025 (Possibility of a 1-year extension)







Position Summary:

We’re hiring a results-driven Data Scientist to build and deploy high-performance ML models across NLP, computer vision, and predictive analytics. You’ll work with modern cloud and data tools (AWS SageMaker, Snowflake, Aurora) to deliver real-time solutions, collaborating with technical teams while operating with autonomy and precision. This role suits someone highly analytical, technically sharp, and fluent in English.




Responsibilities:

Design, build, and refine machine learning models for real-world applications.
Analyse large datasets to extract patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with engineers and analysts to deploy scalable ML solutions.
Automate ML workflows using Snowflake and AWS SageMaker.
Present findings through clear reporting and data visualizations.
Stay current with evolving machine learning tools and techniques.







Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of ML algorithms (regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.).
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker and Snowflake.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and associated ML/data libraries.
Skilled in data visualization (preferably with Tableau).
Fluent English communicator (clear, technical, and to the point).
Background in real-time prediction systems, ideally using Aurora (Desirable)







If you are interested in this role or do have anybody in mind for this position, feel free to apply or get in touch

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI/ML Engineer




Location: Remote (Europe based)




Industry: Life Sciences Quality Management SaaS




About Us: We are a SaaS company specializing in innovative quality management systems (QMS) tailored for the life sciences sector. Our mission is to ensure compliance, enhance quality processes, and improve operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology and AI-driven analytics.




Role Overview: We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer to join our AI & Data Analytics team. You will lead and contribute to impactful projects that leverage advanced machine learning, analytics techniques, and large language models (LLMs). Your primary responsibility will involve designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered features to enhance our platform's capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models, including applications involving large language models (LLMs), to enhance product capabilities.
Analyze structured and unstructured data, including text-based documents and event records.
Conduct data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Utilize semantic search techniques, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) methods, and advanced LLM-based frameworks.
Collaborate with product managers, software developers, and quality assurance teams to integrate and deploy AI features.
Monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance continuously.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields.
3+ years of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or related roles.
Proficiency in Python and key libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
Experience working with LLMs.
Experience in semantic search, document retrieval, text analytics, and prompt engineering.
Robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience processing regulatory documents, compliance texts, or technical documentation in regulated industries
Experience fine-tuning LLMs.
Prior experience within SaaS or life sciences sectors.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and machine learning deployment processes.
Knowledge of vector databases and modern AI application architectures.




Soft Skills:

Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to translate complex technical solutions into understandable insights for business stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and commitment to quality outcomes.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, innovative environment with opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, Power BI)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are hiring for one of our major clients for the below requirement




Job Details:

Role: Machine Learning Developer – LLM & Chatbot Specialist

Employment Type: 6 months & extendable contract, outsourced

Work Location: 100% remote role

Notice Period: Immediate joiners to a maximum of 15 days of notice




QUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.

Title: Data scientist AI
Description:
For one of my customers, we are looking for a Data Scientist.

Location: Europe (100% Remote)

Duration: 6+ months renewable




Description :

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to support our client's data science team. The ideal candidate is highly skilled in Python, SQL, and Azure, and has practical experience working with LLMs, machine learning, and modern data architectures.




Objectives:

The candidate should be excellent in data driven solutioning and problem solving
The candidate will be expected to have a comprehensive understanding of the business, the data models and business/data flows.
Should be comfortable taking on data analyst tasks if needed, and to interface with business
Ability to work independently, taking ownership and being a team player are key requirements
Knowledge of ML and LLMs and MLops/pipelines will be a big plus




Required Skills:

Expert-level Python (Full stack)
Advanced SQL
Strong experience in data science and data modelling
Experience with Azure cloud services
Good working knowledge of LLMs and Generative AI
Familiar with ML workflows, pipelines, and MLOps

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
A major enterprise in the financial sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join its cross-functional AI & Data team. This role focuses on enabling production-ready Machine Learning pipelines and ensuring seamless integration of ML solutions into enterprise-grade systems.

You'll bridge the gap between Data Science and IT Operations by ensuring that deployed ML models are scalable, reliable, and continuously monitored, contributing to both the technical and business performance of AI-driven services.

Key responsibilities

Collaborate with Data Scientists to define and build ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Design and implement automation for ML pipelines, including containerization (Docker/VM), testing (unit/integration/regression), and deployment using CI/CD tools.
Support the integration of AI services using existing industrial tools and platforms.
Work with IT Production teams to parameterize and maintain ML environments.
Ensure model reliability, retraining strategies, and monitoring across technical and business dimensions.

Required skills & experience

Professional experience

Minimum of 4 years of experience in a similar role
Prior experience working within Agile methodologies

Technical expertise (mandatory)

Containerization & Virtualization (Docker, VM)
CI/CD tooling (GitLab CI or equivalent)
AI platforms and development environments (IDEs)
Version Control (code, model, data)
Python programming
Dependency/package management
PostgreSQL

Technical expertise (nice to have)

Integration across varied tech stacks (e.g., distributed systems, mainframes)
Model optimization (e.g., compression techniques)
ELT / ETL pipelines
Big Data processing tools (e.g., Spark)
Data visualization and real-time data flow tools

Soft skills

Strong communication (written and oral)
Results-oriented with attention to detail
Creative problem-solver and continuous learner
Efficient, proactive, and adaptable
Team player who thrives in a dynamic, evolving environment

Title: Data Scientist - TWE42320
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Python, Gen AI, LLM




Location: Remote (EU only)

Start Date: 11/08/2025

Duration: 9 months

Engagement: Freelance/Contract

Time zone: CEST




Customer overview

Our client is a global leader in science and advanced materials, driving innovation across sectors such as energy, mobility, and industrial manufacturing. With deep roots in chemistry and sustainability, they are at the forefront of developing breakthrough technologies for a cleaner future. The organization has a strong international footprint, with major operations across Europe and LATAM. You'll be joining a forward-thinking, data-driven team contributing to impactful AI initiatives.




Project Overview

The customer is building an internal Sales AI Copilot, an intelligent assistant designed to enhance sales processes with data-driven insights and generative AI capabilities. You will join the data science team supporting this effort, contributing your expertise in Python, Azure, and LLMs to shape and implement advanced AI solutions.




About the Role

We are seeking a senior Data Scientist who is both technically strong and business-aware. This role requires someone who is equally at ease coding in Python and pandas, querying in SQL, leveraging large language models (LLMs), and engaging with business stakeholders to align data science solutions with operational needs.

You’ll be expected to take initiative, operate independently, and collaborate closely with a distributed, multicultural team across Europe and LATAM.




Key Responsibilities

Support data science team in developing and scaling AI-based solutions for the Sales AI Copilot
Deliver robust, scalable data science models and pipelines using Python, Azure, and SQL
Apply LLM and generative AI knowledge to solve real-world business problems
Understand and contribute to the organization’s data architecture and business flows
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable solutions
Perform data analysis and ensure data quality and model integrity
Take ownership of tasks while fostering a collaborative and communicative environment
Support occasional data analyst responsibilities or interface tasks with the business when required




Work Environment

Remote role with distributed teams across LATAM & EU
Hybrid of waterfall and agile sprints




Required Skills & Experience

Skill Level

Full Stack Python & Pandas Expert
Generative AI / LLM Practitioner Confirmed
SQL (especially SQL on Azure) Confirmed
Azure (Cloud & ML Services) Confirmed
Machine Learning Models Confirmed
Data Science (problem-solving, modeling) Expert
Git / Version Control Working Knowledge




Nice to Have

Experience with MLOps and ML pipelines
Familiarity with SAFE frameworks or hybrid Agile/Waterfall environments
Working knowledge of Spanish or French (due to LATAM and European team distribution)
Prior experience with interface tasks or business function collaboration

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI / QA
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Zyte. We are currently looking for a Data Scientist - Gen AI / QA in Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay, Poland, Spain, Portugal, UK, Ireland, Croatia, Hungary, Slovenia.

As a Data Scientist specializing in Generative AI and QA, you'll play a key role in advancing data quality validation processes for large-scale web-extracted data. This is a highly technical, detail-oriented position where you will apply Python, AI, and data visualization techniques to detect and resolve data inconsistencies, automate quality checks, and deliver trusted results. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fully remote, global environment, supporting enterprise-grade customers. If you're passionate about leveraging AI to solve data problems at scale, this is a high-impact opportunity in a fast-evolving space.

Accountabilities


Design and implement AI-powered data quality validation techniques based on customer-specific web scraping requirements
Analyze and summarize large datasets through descriptive statistics, summaries, and visualizations to uncover quality issues
Extend manual QA processes with automated, AI-driven verification tools
Communicate findings and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including QA engineers, developers, PMs, and clients
Collaborate with the engineering team to identify root causes of data issues and propose technical solutions
Write robust, reusable code following best practices in Python and version control systems such as GitHub or BitBucket



Requirements


At least 3 years of hands-on experience with Python and the PyData stack (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Solid understanding of Generative AI, especially in the context of web scraping, parsing, and data quality automation
Comfortable with prompt engineering and optimization techniques (token/cost control)
Familiarity with frameworks like MCP, Marvin, Langchain, and experience with OpenAI, Google, or Anthropic APIs
Skilled in analyzing and visualizing large-scale datasets (millions of records), with strong attention to detail
Working knowledge of QA methodologies and tools for validating structured and unstructured data
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to explain technical concepts to varied audiences



Preferred:


Prior experience in a Data QA role focused on data integrity rather than application testing
Familiarity with Jupyter/JupyterLab, Spark, BigQuery, and dashboard creation
Experience in fully remote, globally distributed teams



Benefits


Join a diverse, self-motivated team across 28+ countries
Enjoy full flexibility to work remotely from where you perform best
Collaborate on cutting-edge data technologies and open-source tools
Attend global conferences and regular team events
Thrive in a culture that values ownership, innovation, and continuous learning



Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.

🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the 3 candidates with the highest match to the role.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role.

Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.

Thank you for your interest!

Design, build, and deploy machine learning models into production environments

Collaborate with developers and product teams to translate business needs into technical solutions
Optimize model performance and ensure scalability

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

🌐Language: Fluent English; Dutch OR French is required.

📄 Work Authorization: Valid work permit or combined permit to work in Belgium is required

🔥Keywords: Python, Machine Learning , IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code) , AI platforms




🧠 About the Role

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science and production engineering. You’ll play a key role in transforming ML models into scalable, production-ready solutions that deliver real business value.

🎯 What You’ll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists to design ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Build and automate ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD tools.
Deploy, monitor, and retrain models in production environments.
Ensure robust data flow, versioning, and model performance tracking.
Support IT teams in configuring and maintaining production infrastructure.
Promote best practices in ML engineering across teams.

🛠️ What You Bring

Must-Have Technical Skills
Python programming
Containerization (Docker, VMs)
CI/CD (e.g., GitLab CI)
AI platforms & IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code)
Code, model & data versioning
PostgreSQL
Dependency and package management

Nice-to-Have

Experience with distributed systems or mainframe integration
Model compression techniques
ETL/ELT tools
Big Data tools (e.g., Spark)
Data flow processing and visualization tools

💼 Business & Soft Skills

Agile methodology experience
Strong communication (written & verbal)
Detail-oriented and results-driven
Creative problem solver
Continuous learner with a proactive mindset
Open to feedback and innovation.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
🧠 Key Responsibilities

Develop, train, and evaluate deep neural networks for tasks such as [e.g., image recognition, NLP, speech, time-series forecasting].
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and deployment constraints (e.g., latency, memory, throughput).
Implement model training pipelines using frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to prepare and preprocess large-scale datasets.
Contribute to model deployment using tools like ONNX, TensorRT, or cloud-native solutions (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in deep learning research and techniques.

🧰 Required Skills & Experience

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience in deep learning.
Proficient in Python and deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras).
Solid understanding of neural network architectures (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, GANs, etc.).
Experience with data pipeline tools (e.g., Pandas, Dask, Airflow) and model versioning (MLflow, Weights & Biases).
Strong knowledge of software engineering practices: Git, Docker, CI/CD.
Comfortable working in a Linux-based environment.

✅ Nice to Have

Experience with edge AI or model quantization/pruning.
Knowledge of MLOps principles and deployment on Kubernetes.
Familiarity with regulatory or ethical aspects of AI in Europe (e.g., GDPR, AI Act).
Previous experience in a freelance/consulting capacity in Belgium.

Show more
HTML:
🧠 Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, train, and evaluate deep neural networks for tasks such as [e.g., image recognition, NLP, speech, time-series forecasting].
  • Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and deployment constraints (e.g., latency, memory, throughput).
  • Implement model training pipelines using frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to prepare and preprocess large-scale datasets.
  • Contribute to model deployment using tools like ONNX, TensorRT, or cloud-native solutions (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in deep learning research and techniques.

🧰 Required Skills & Experience

  • MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in deep learning.
  • Proficient in Python and deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras).
  • Solid understanding of neural network architectures (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, GANs, etc.).
  • Experience with data pipeline tools (e.g., Pandas, Dask, Airflow) and model versioning (MLflow, Weights & Biases).
  • Strong knowledge of software engineering practices: Git, Docker, CI/CD.
  • Comfortable working in a Linux-based environment.

✅ Nice to Have

  • Experience with edge AI or model quantization/pruning.
  • Knowledge of MLOps principles and deployment on Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with regulatory or ethical aspects of AI in Europe (e.g., GDPR, AI Act).
  • Previous experience in a freelance/consulting capacity in Belgium.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist.
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP




A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.




Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.




Key Responsibilities

Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics




Mandatory Skills

4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery




Nice to Have

Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Show more

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.





Job Description



They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.







ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:



Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment



Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.





Additional Information



Technical Experience Required:



Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql





Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are actively looking for several AI Engineers to join our client.




What You Will Do

Architect and implement scalable AI and data-driven solutions (spanning ML pipelines, NLP, computer vision, and analytics)
Work end-to-end on data strategy: from ingestion/ETL to model deployment/inference
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify AI opportunities and deliver prototypes in Agile sprints
Ensure robust data quality, governance, compliance, and model explainability (XAI/ethics)
Maintain and optimize cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) for ML/AI workloads
Mentor junior engineers and share best practices in code, data, ethics, and AI tooling




What You Bring

5+ years in software engineering or data engineering, including 3+ years in AI/ML model development
Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow / PyTorch), SQL, and cloud computing
Experience with LLM, AI ethics, or explainable AI
Advanced knowledge of data pipelines / ETL, CI/CD, and MLOps best practices
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience in finance or enterprise sectors is a major plus




Interested? Apply immediately!

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Show more
HTML:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.


What is the job about?

  • Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
  • Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
  • Mentoring colleagues
  • Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
  • Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
  • Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
  • Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
  • IT profiles
  • Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

  • Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
  • A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
  • Other types of eduction are also valued.
  • A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
  • Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
  • Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
  • The desire to learn and grow
  • A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
  • Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

  • An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
  • A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
  • Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
  • Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
  • A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
  • A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
  • Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
  • An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.




What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Show more

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.
