Title: Data Scientist
Description:
SamanTree Medical is an innovative Belgian-Swiss medical device company dedicated to improving patient care and operating room efficiency through breakthrough imaging technology. The company develops and manufactures the Histolog Scanner, an advanced imaging solution that enables real-time analysis of fresh tissue samples. This visualization modality supports a wide range of surgical and diagnostic applications. SamanTree Medical is actively commercializing the Histolog Scanner across Europe and the United States.




SamanTree is built on the passion and dedication of talented people from diverse backgrounds. We believe that breakthrough ideas can come from anywhere, so we foster a culture rooted in diversity, respect, and open-mindedness. Leading with inclusion, we empower our team members to bring their best, most authentic selves to work each day.




Our culture thrives on purpose-driven individuals who aspire to make a meaningful impact. Team members here are grounded in integrity, eager to learn, fueled by energy, and bring a wealth of diverse, real-world perspectives that drive innovative thinking. We’re committed to our people’s long-term growth, actively investing in their potential to advance our mission and inspire them to achieve their highest potential.




Join a team setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra-Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

For more information, please visit https://www.samantree.com/




To ensure the growth of SamanTree Medical, we are looking for:




Data Scientist, Lausanne (Switzerland)




In the R&D department, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. You will contribute to the development of digital products and extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, making them available to relevant teams to support data-driven decision-making and operational improvements.

Responsibilities

Developing deep sector-specific data expertise in confocal microscopy images, to actively contribute to data annotation activities and coordinate outsourced image annotation workflows
Selecting, organizing, managing, and preserving data to ensure its long-term value and accessibility for specific users or purposes
Interacting with colleagues from a cross-functional team on various data-related projects for understanding the needs for technical data solutions, defining solutions concepts and design, providing training and retrieving feedback.
Collaborating closely to the development of data analytics based components under design control, in accordance with ISO 13485 and FDA Quality System Regulations.
Conducting feasibility and proof-of-concept projects to further improve and standardize the performances, usability and adoption of SamanTree Medical’s products
Performing technical reviews and contributing to the development of test procedures of existing data processes




Skills, Qualifications and Experience

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
You are attentive to details and committed to maintaining data accuracy and quality.
You have experience in applying data science techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably on images. 1 to 3 years of experience in a similar position is a plus.
You are proficient in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
You are a strong team player with the ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English, both written and spoken; you communicate fluently in French (spoken).




At least one of the following applies to you :

You have a strong interest in data visualization and enjoy transforming data into clear, compelling visuals
You enjoy digging into databases of text and/or images until you find the answer to a complex data question
You are enthusiastic about AI and machine learning and have experience with training models on images




Our offer

A 100 % or 80 % job
Primarily on-site work (maximum 1 day homeworking per week)
An attractive and competitive salary package in line with your profile and experience
A challenging and diversified position within a high-potential fast-growing innovative medical device company.
A human-size, dynamic, respectful, and collaborative work environment
International exposure, with learning and development opportunities.
A role that directly contributes to the improvement of global healthcare outcomes




How to Apply

Please combine your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and language skills into a single document and submit it via the LinkedIn "CV upload" option.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are all proud to work for such a great company as Samantree Medical. And we would be even prouder to have you on board. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, regardless of your race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Please apply if you see a position that makes your heartbeat, and if you feel the role is appealing to you. If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.




Join a team that’s setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Show more

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.


Join a team that’s setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

  • Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
  • Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
  • Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
  • An interest in learning about the commodities space
  • Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
  • Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
  • Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
  • Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
  • Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
  • A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
  • Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
  • Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements
Show more

Title: Research Scientist - Neuroscience (80-100%*)
Description:
Summary

The Neuroscience Department within BioMedical Research at Novartis Pharma AG in Basel, Switzerland, is searching for a motivated and experienced Research or Senior Scientist. This individual will assume a hands-on role within the in vivo neuroinflammation team and contribute to several research projects focused on the development of new therapies for neurodegenerative disorders, potentially helping improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide suffering neurodegenerative illnesses and conditions.

The main focus will be on novel neuroimmune cell pathways to elucidate the mechanisms at the molecular, cellular and ex vivo/in vivo level.

Joining our team you will independently but with close collaboration with the other members of the Neurosciences group plan, execute, document, analyze and interpret experiments.

About The Role

Your responsibilities will include:


Designing, conducting and protocolling independently in vivo studies with specific focus on neuroinflammatory pathways
Establishment of new in vivo models for neuroinflammatory/neurodegenerative diseases
Performing and interpreting ex vivo analyses with emphasis on histology, biochemistry, FACS and molecular biology
Development and execution of in vitro cellular assays for assessing inflammatory processes
Presenting data and putting it in a complex context
Supporting general laboratory duties


Your Profile


University degree (MSc) or equivalent qualification, preferably in neuroscience, immunology, cell biology. *Please note that PhD candidates will not be considered for this position*
Minimum 2-3 years relevant lab based work experience in an industrial or academic setting
Previous experience in neuroscience drug discovery area would be an advantage.
Strong expertise in in vivo rodent work e.g. different routes of dosing, surgery, stereotactic brain injections, behavior, perfusion. Relevant animal experiment course available (e.g. LTK1)
Experience in different histological methods, microscopy and image analyses
Experience in RNA/DNA technologies and biochemistry, e.g. qPCR technologies, Westernblot
Good knowledge of immunology and immunological methods such as flow cytometry, HTRF, ELISA
Good knowledge in cell culture work, e.g. primary cells, iPSCs
Used to evaluating large datasets, strong documentation capabilities and interest to use new informatics analysis tools
Eager to learn and combine new techniques and concepts, to present results within the lab, to use and apply literature data, to perform exploratory activities and to work independently and as a team member
Scientific curiosity, initiative, commitment, flexibility and good organization skills
Track record of successful collaborations, open communication with different stakeholders, strong team player and networker
Excellent oral and written English


Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to inclusion.switzerland@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
Qui nous sommes




SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :




> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

> Un système qualité performant

> Des services adaptables et évolutifs




Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.







Missions




Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.







Profil




5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.







Informations complémentaires




Date de début : dès que possible
Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
Durée : Long terme
Langue : Français et anglais
Nationalité européenne requise
Show more

  • Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.



Informations complémentaires


  • Date de début : dès que possible
  • Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
  • Durée : Long terme
  • Langue : Français et anglais
  • Nationalité européenne requise

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

At Roche, we thrive to deliver more benefits to our patients as part of our 10-year Pharma vision. An integral part to achieving this vision is to deliver new and innovative data analytics solutions to our scientists across Pharma Technical Operations (PT). To do so, we have formed a new organization called PT Digital and Operational Excellence (PTE) with the aspiration to digitally transform and to become a lean organization.

PTE is the new organization that catalyzes the global development and execution of PT’s Digital and Operational Excellence strategy to enable PT to realize our performance promises. We build a strong cross-functional and inclusive community, further develop the Lean and Digital skills across PT, and scale up our Digital and Advanced Analytics solutions, for the benefit of our colleagues and patients.

We aim to activate a data citizenship mindset and a digital mind, revolutionize our FAIR data ecosystem and systems landscape, re-design excellent processes, and generate transformative insights. We collaborate closely with global functions to deliver impactful value to our patients.

The Opportunity

You will function as an innovator, inventor, investigator, partner, engineer, “firefighter,” and scientist. This includes planning, executing, and delivering AI-based projects, analyzing problems, and exploring datasets.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: As part of cross-functional use case teams, you will tackle high-pressing business problems, becoming familiar with our product-related data, manufacturing processes, and systems
Data Analysis and AI Solutions: You will preprocess structured and unstructured data with the support of Data Engineers to build new Data Products (Data Mesh). Analyze small to medium amounts of static and real-time data to identify trends and patterns, and implement analysis pipelines. Develop AI solutions to resolve issues for our partners (e.g., Quality, Regulatory, Manufacturing)
Junior Technical Lead: As a Junior Technical Lead, you will support the team by driving key digital initiatives and collaborating with stakeholders across IT and PT functions. Your responsibilities include:
Work with IT and PT stakeholders to plan, execute, and sustain digital solutions
Help define and manage user requirements and backlogs, support use case deployments from diagnosis to implementation
Coordinate with data scientists, data engineers, UX/UI designers, IT specialists, and SMEs. Aid in value tracking and capability building
Partner with end customers to develop new analytics capabilities and share best practices
Scope: The initial scope of your projects will primarily be in the PTGenAI team, supporting process improvement, portfolio management, data management, workforce strategy, product delivery


Who You Are:


Education and Experience: You have a Master’s Degree with 1-2 years of relevant work experience in Pharma, holding a degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, or a related quantitative field. A PhD is advantageous
Technical and Business Skills: Proficient in advanced analytics and biotech, data pipelining, modeling concepts, and AI platform ecosystems. Skilled in various AI and machine learning algorithms, programming languages (Python, R), data visualization, and cloud computing (GCP/AWS). Familiarity with Dataiku and large data sets is a plus
Interpersonal Skills: Strong relationship management, leadership, and communication skills. Ability to influence without formal authority, inspire cross-functional teams, and communicate complex ideas effectively. Experience with agile methodologies and innovation frameworks is beneficial
Mindset: Outcome-focused, proactive, customer-centric, and capable of strategic and analytical thinking. Demonstrates an enterprise mindset and entrepreneurial behaviors, identifying user needs and generating viable solutions creatively
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Be part of a cross-functional use case team addressing high-pressing business problems, familiarizing yourself with product-related data, manufacturing processes, and systems
Data Analysis and AI Solutions: Undertake data preprocessing, analyze static and real-time data to discover trends, and implement analysis pipelines. Build AI solutions to predict and solve manufacturing-related issues
Agility and Innovation: Demonstrate agility in working, communicating a compelling story and complex concepts with aspirational language, and applying elements of FAIR Data Citizenship in decision-making processes


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
L’EOC l’ospedale multisito del Ticino è presente con i suoi istituti sull'intero territorio cantonale per un totale di 1’000 posti letto. L’organizzazione permette di combinare efficacemente approccio locale e visione d'insieme, garantendo alla popolazione un'offerta ospedaliera globale e di prossimità, indipendentemente dal luogo in cui sono richiesti i servizi.

Grazie all’impegno e alla competenza degli oltre 6’500 collaboratori e alla loro attenzione verso la relazione umana, l’EOC assicura un’assistenza sanitaria di qualità prendendosi cura di oltre 41'000 pazienti degenti all’anno e fornendo oltre 600'000 consulti ambulatoriali.

L’Ente Ospedaliero Cantonale (EOC) e la Scuola universitaria professionale della Svizzera Italiana (SUPSI) mettono congiuntamente a concorso una posizione a tempo pieno (50% EOC e 50% SUPSI) da integrare nel team Innovation and Research dell’Area Informatica dell’EOC e nell’area di ricerca in Natural Language Processing and Information retrieval presso l’Istituto Dalle Molle per l’Intelligenza Artificiale (IDSIA).

Data Scientist (100%)

a tempo determinato di 2 anni

Profilo

La ricercatrice / il ricercatore lavorerà allo sviluppo e all'applicazione di nuove tecniche di machine learning (ML) e generative AI applicate alla documentazione medica.

Requisiti necessari


Background accademico (MSc o PhD) in informatica o campi affini.
Spiccata abilità nella programmazione in Python, comprovata esperienza nell’uso di framework come PyTorch/TensorFlow.
Conoscenze approfondite nell’uso di modelli linguistici di grandi dimensioni (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) e applicazioni reali, soprattutto in ambito sanitario.
Capacità di lavorare in modo indipendente e orientata agli obiettivi.
Attitudine al lavoro in team e all’interazione con i portatori di interesse.
Conoscenza della lingua inglese e preferibilmente di almeno due lingue nazionali, tra le quali l’italiano.


Data d'entrata

1 settembre 2025

Le candidature (in italiano o inglese), in formato elettronico, dovranno essere depositate sull'apposita piattaforma entro il 3 agosto 2025 complete di


lettera di motivazione
curriculum vitae e trascrizioni universitarie complete
elenco delle pubblicazioni ed un eventuale collegamento ad una tesi di dottorato
copie dei certificati di studio e di lavoro
Almeno 2 referenze.


Candidature che giungeranno oltre questa data non saranno tenute in considerazione, così come quelle prevenute in forma cartacea o via e-mail.

Ulteriori informazioni possono essere richieste a Lorenzo Ruinelli, Capo gruppo Innovation and Research EOC, lorenzo.ruinelli@eoc.ch, o a Fabio Rinaldi, Ricercatore senior IDSIA, fabio.rinaldi@supsi.ch.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
THIS JOB IS NOT A REMOTE JOB. WORK ONSITE IS OBLIGATORY.




Snapbau is a digital purchasing management platform used by more than 320 construction companies in Switzerland, including major players such as Orllati, CPSA, Scrasa and ARSA. Our solution automates and optimises the management of calls for tender and purchasing, enabling companies to save time, reduce errors and centralise collaboration with suppliers.




You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building the AI layer of Snapbau’s digital operating system for procurement and coordination in the construction sector.


Tasks


AI System Design & Development





Develop machine learning and AI models to automate and optimize construction procurement workflows (e.g. price prediction, document classification, lead scoring, supplier matching).


Build generative AI features to assist with document generation, meeting summaries, and structured communication.


Create and maintain pipelines for training, testing, and deploying ML models.


Develop lightweight APIs or services to integrate AI modules into the Snapbau platform.





Data Engineering & Management





Work closely with backend developers to structure, clean, and extract usable data from various sources (e.g. supplier databases, project histories, tender documents).


Apply construction-specific taxonomies (e.g. eBKP-H, CRB) to enable structured, domain-relevant decision-making.


Improve model performance through effective feature engineering based on our domain data.





Product Integration





Collaborate with product managers and frontend developers to design and implement AI-powered tools for end users.


Ensure AI components are integrated into Snapbau’s user experience in a fast, reliable, and intuitive way.


Monitor model performance post-deployment and adjust based on feedback and new data.





Strategy & Innovation





Contribute to Snapbau’s long-term AI architecture and roadmap.


Stay updated on advancements in applied AI (LLMs, computer vision, agent workflows, etc.) and evaluate their relevance for construction tech.


Help define AI-related hiring, tooling, and infrastructure needs as the team scales.



Requirements



Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models (especially NLP, classification, recommendation, or price prediction).


Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, FastAPI.


Experience building and maintaining ML pipelines.


Familiarity with REST APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.


Solid understanding of data wrangling and structuring from messy or unstructured sources.


Knowledge of or willingness to learn domain-specific standards such as eBKP-H or CRB is a strong plus.


Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional product teams.


Ability to work autonomously while contributing to a strategic, long-term vision.





Join Snapbau if you want to shape how AI transforms the future of construction procurement. This role offers high impact, deep technical ownership, and a direct path into one of the most overlooked but critical sectors of the real economy.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
Experience in supply chain management.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role Responsibilities


Working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
Developing high quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams
Focusing on modelling, working alongside the Data Engineering team
Presenting findings, recommendations and providing consultation to stakeholders (internal and clients)


What You’ll Learn


Work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science
Build large-scale data & analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
Best practices in data & analytics development including framework, responsibility model, high quality code, data security, sustainability and scalability
Work in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, fostering effective teamwork and learning from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies as well as first class learning programs
Develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities


You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data & analytics.

Who You Are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CuasalNex, MLRun (check out more OSS here: https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/quantumblack/labs). We work on regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:

  • Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
  • A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
  • Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
  • World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role Responsibilities

  • Working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
  • Developing high quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams
  • Focusing on modelling, working alongside the Data Engineering team
  • Presenting findings, recommendations and providing consultation to stakeholders (internal and clients)

What You’ll Learn

  • Work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science
  • Build large-scale data & analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
  • Best practices in data & analytics development including framework, responsibility model, high quality code, data security, sustainability and scalability
  • Work in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, fostering effective teamwork and learning from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies as well as first class learning programs
  • Develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities

You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data & analytics.

Who You Are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CuasalNex, MLRun (check out more OSS here: https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/quantumblack/labs). We work on regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
  • Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
  • Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
  • A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
  • Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
  • Proficient communication skills in German and English
  • Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
  • Practical experience in generative AI application development
  • Proven record of advisory works
  • Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of advanced data models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses. This role aims to drive strategic decision-making and solve high-impact business challenges across various functions. The Senior Data Scientist will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions, integrate insights, and optimize business outcomes.

The role requires a deep understanding of data science principles, strong analytical skills, and proficiency in machine learning techniques. It also involves working on data wrangling, exploratory analysis, and model deployment, with a focus on achieving production-ready AI/ML solutions that are aligned with business goals.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop End-to-End Data Science Projects: Lead data science initiatives from business exploration and model prototyping to deployment and performance monitoring.
Data Collection and Integration: Collect and integrate data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and cloud platforms, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean, preprocess, and validate datasets to ensure they meet quality standards for analysis.
Model Development: Design and develop predictive models and AI systems to optimize manufacturing operations, enable predictive maintenance, and improve supply chain logistics.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineering teams and business stakeholders to ensure that AI/ML solutions are aligned with business objectives and production-ready.
Communication: Effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences through reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Continuous Learning: Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in data science and artificial intelligence, ensuring that the organization remains on the cutting edge of technology.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in data science or a related field, with expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and model deployment.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and experimental design.
Hands-on experience with data wrangling and model development.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and model deployment in different infrastructures.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams to achieve business goals.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs, approximately 15 %

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems




Your profile

M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, …)
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Project Description:

We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modeling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineer
Description:
Application period 14-Jul-2025 to 15-Aug-2025

Functional Responsibilities:

Under the supervision of the UNOPS Project Manager and in close collaboration with IAH, the AI Engineer will perform the following key functions: 2. AI solution integration with an enterprise data architecture 3. Responsible AI & Risk Management


Development of AI agents and custom Copilot-based end-to-end solutions
Implement custom Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines with vector search and document intelligence.
Build function calling capabilities to trigger real-time backend services or frontend actions.
Develop agentic AI systems that can reason, orchestrate multi-step tasks, and generate responses dynamically.
Design AI solutions with Model Context Protocol to enable multi-step reasoning, memory retrieval, and agent-to-agent continuity.
Engineer secure and scalable integrations between AI systems, OHCHR’s Data Foundation (Fabric/OneLake), APIs, and application layers.
Build and deliver the OHCHR Data as a Service project, including AI-driven querying and interactive data visualization triggers.
Use Azure AI Foundry and other orchestration tools to build multi-model, composable AI solutions.
Develop and maintain APIs, microservices, and frontend code (JavaScript/React/Next.js) to support AI capabilities.
Perform hands-on evaluation, testing, and benchmarking of AI models and frameworks across providers (Microsoft Azure/OpenAI, Google, AWS, open-source).
Lead the implementation of red teaming, validation, and testing pipelines for AI solution safety, compliance, and robustness.



Education/Experience/Language requirements:

*FEMALE CANDIDATES ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

*CANDIDATES WITH NO UNITED NATIONS OR UNOPS EXPERIENCE ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

Education


Advanced university degree (Master’s degree or equivalent) preferably in computer science, information systems, data science, data analytics, or in a field related to the post description with five (5) years of relevant experience is required; OR
A first-level university degree (Bachelor’s degree or equivalent) preferably in computer science, information systems, data science, data analytics, or in a field related to the post description with seven (7) years of relevant experience is desirable.



Work Experience

Required:


Relevant experience is defined as experience building multimodal RAG systems, function calling, and AI agent orchestration.
Experience with AI context protocols, including prompt engineering, memory retrieval, and building agentic systems capable of context-aware reasoning and actions is required
Deep hands-on expertise in Python (FastAPI, LangChain, Azure AI services), Nodejs, and JavaScript/TypeScript (React, Next.js) is required
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure (Azure AI Foundry, Fabric/OneLake, API Management) and/or ability to work across multiple AI providers is required
Solid background in cloud architecture, secure APIs, identity (Entra ID), and governance is required
Ability to deliver working code, AI models, and deployed solutions independently and efficiently is required



Desirable:


Familiarity with digital product development, agile methodologies, or human-centered design is an asset.
Awareness of AI ethics, responsible AI, and human rights considerations is desirable
Experience working with or within the UN system or similar international organization is desirable.



Language


Fluency in English (read, write, speak) is required.
Knowledge of French is desirable.
Knowledge of another UN official language is an advantage.


Think big. Meet challenges head-on. Help people build better lives.
UNOPS embraces diversity and is committed to equal employment opportunities. Our workforce is made up of people from varied nationalities, cultures and races. They speak a range of languages and have different gender identities, sexual orientations, and abilities.
We encourage women and candidates from underrepresented groups in UNOPS to apply. These include candidates from racialized and/or indigenous groups, members of minority gender identities and sexual orientations, and people with disabilities. Click apply and join us!

Remarks: Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
Proclinical Staffing hat sich mit einem etablierten und wachsenden Schweizer IT-Dienstleister zusammengeschlossen, um dessen Teamausbau durch die Einstellung eines AI Software Engineer zu unterstützen. Mein Kunde beschäftigt derzeit über 700 Mitarbeitende und ist auf End-to-End-Dienstleistungen für maßgeschneiderte und integrative Lösungen im Bereich verteilter Softwaresysteme spezialisiert.

Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten

Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Projektteams als praxisorientierter Softwareentwickler unter Einsatz von Technologien wie Java, Angular und Docker
Übernahme der Rolle des AI-Champions im Team und zentrale Ansprechperson für alle KI-bezogenen Themen
Funktion als Hauptansprechpartner für KI-Themen zur Sicherstellung von Klarheit und Abstimmung im Projekt
Identifikation und Bewertung sinnvoller KI-Anwendungsfälle, z. B. LLMs, RAG, Copilots und Prompt Engineering
Förderung des Wissensaustauschs durch KI-Workshops, Schulungen und Pair Programming
Leitung der Entwicklung von Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) und Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) für KI-gestützte Funktionen
Unterstützung des Product Owners bei der Priorisierung von KI-Initiativen und der Erstellung umsetzbarer User Stories
Beobachtung aktueller Entwicklungen und Trends im KI-Bereich und Einbringung innovativer Ideen ins Team
Pflege und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung der technischen KI-Dokumentation des Projekts

Deine Fähigkeiten

Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Fullstack-Entwickler (Java, Spring Boot, Angular, Docker etc.)
Erste praktische Erfahrung mit LLMs, RAG, Prompt Engineering und KI-gestützter Softwareentwicklung
Vertraut mit Cloud-Umgebungen (Azure, AWS), Git, CI/CD und Container-Technologien
Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden wie Scrum, Kanban oder SAFe

Dein Profil

Engagierter und erfahrener Softwareentwickler mit über 5 Jahren Berufserfahrung
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Große Begeisterung für neue Technologien mit einem starken Fokus auf praxisnahe KI-Integration
Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Konzepte verständlich für technische und nicht-technische Zielgruppen zu vermitteln
Pragmatische und praxisorientierte Umsetzung von KI-Lösungen mit Fokus auf den realen Nutzen
Neugierig, motiviert und inspirierend, mit der Fähigkeit, Innovation und Zusammenarbeit im Team zu fördern
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Timothy Deschamps unter der t.deschamps@proclinical.com.

Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.

Proclinical Staffing ist außerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

Show more

Mein Kunde beschäftigt derzeit über 700 Mitarbeitende und ist auf End-to-End-Dienstleistungen für maßgeschneiderte und integrative Lösungen im Bereich verteilter Softwaresysteme spezialisiert.
